name: Front Kick (Mae Geri)
description: A fundamental forward kick executed with the ball of the foot, targeting the opponent's midsection. One of the first techniques learned in Karate.

name: Roundhouse Kick (Mawashi Geri)
description: A circular kick that strikes with the instep or shin, one of the most powerful and versatile kicks in martial arts.

name: Side Kick (Yoko Geri)
description: A powerful linear kick delivered sideways with the heel, excellent for maintaining distance and generating power.

name: Back Kick (Ushiro Geri)
description: A rear kick executed by thrusting the heel backwards, one of the most powerful kicks when properly executed.

name: Crescent Kick (Mikazuki Geri)
description: A sweeping kick that moves in a crescent arc, useful for warm-ups and developing flexibility.

name: Axe Kick (Kakato Geri)
description: A downward striking kick where the leg is raised high and brought down like an axe, hitting with the heel.

name: Hook Kick
description: A deceptive kick that appears to miss before snapping back to strike with the heel, requires good flexibility.

name: Spinning Back Kick
description: A powerful spinning variation of the back kick, generating momentum through the spin for devastating impact.

name: Spinning Hook Kick
description: An advanced spinning kick also known as a spinning whip kick, used for powerful head-level strikes.

name: Tornado Kick
description: A jumping, spinning kick that combines a 360-degree spin with a roundhouse kick, spectacular and effective.

name: Flying Side Kick
description: A jumping side kick executed while airborne, used to strike high targets or cover distance quickly.

name: Double Kick
description: Two kicks executed in quick succession with the same leg, testing balance and speed.

name: Low Kick
description: A kick aimed at the opponent's leg, typically the thigh or calf, used to damage mobility and set up combinations.

name: Teep (Push Kick)
description: A forward pushing kick using the ball of the foot to create distance and disrupt the opponent's balance.

name: Switch Kick
description: A deceptive kick where you switch stance mid-motion to deliver a powerful roundhouse kick.

name: Question Mark Kick
description: A deceptive kick that starts low like a teep but snaps up high like a roundhouse to the head.

name: Oblique Kick
description: A linear kick to the opponent's knee, used to disrupt structure and damage the leg.

name: Calf Kick
description: A low roundhouse kick targeting the calf muscle, extremely effective in modern MMA.

name: Jab
description: A quick, straight punch with the lead hand, the most important punch in boxing for measuring distance.

name: Cross
description: A powerful straight punch thrown with the rear hand, one of the most damaging punches in boxing.

name: Hook
description: A semi-circular punch thrown with either hand, targeting the side of the opponent's head or body.

name: Uppercut
description: An upward punch from a crouched position targeting the chin or solar plexus, devastating at close range.

name: Overhand
description: A looping punch thrown over the opponent's guard, sacrificing some speed for power and angle.

name: Jab-Cross Combination
description: The most fundamental boxing combination: lead jab followed immediately by rear cross.

name: Hook-Cross-Hook
description: A three-punch combination that changes angles and keeps the opponent guessing.

name: Elbow Strike (Sok)
description: A close-range strike using the point of the elbow, one of the hardest weapons in Muay Thai.

name: Flying Knee (Kao Loi)
description: An explosive jumping knee strike aimed at the opponent's head or body, signature Muay Thai technique.

name: Knee Strike (Kao)
description: A powerful strike using the knee, devastating at close range especially in the clinch.

name: Spinning Elbow
description: A spinning strike with the elbow that can generate knockout power from an unexpected angle.

name: Straight Punch (Choku Zuki)
description: A direct punch executed with hip rotation, fundamental Karate striking technique.

name: Reverse Punch (Gyaku Zuki)
description: A powerful punch thrown with the rear hand while stepping forward, core Karate technique.

name: Backfist Strike (Uraken)
description: A snapping strike using the back of the fist, quick and effective for scoring points.

name: Spinning Backfist
description: A spinning variation of the backfist that generates power through rotation.

name: Hammer Fist
description: A downward strike using the bottom of a closed fist, useful in ground fighting and self-defense.

name: Superman Punch
description: A deceptive aerial punch where you fake a kick and throw a punch while jumping.

name: Palm Strike
description: A strike using the heel of the palm instead of a closed fist, safer for the hand in self-defense.

name: Rising Block (Age Uke)
description: An upward block used to defend against overhead attacks, fundamental Karate defensive technique.

name: Middle Block (Uchi Uke)
description: An inside sweeping block that deflects attacks to the midsection using the forearm.

name: Lower Block (Gedan Barai)
description: A downward sweeping block used to defend against low attacks to the legs or midsection.

name: Knife Hand Block (Shuto Uke)
description: A block using the edge of the open hand, can also be used as a strike.

name: X-Block
description: A cross-armed block used against powerful overhead attacks, crossing the wrists in an X shape.

name: Parry
description: A deflecting block that redirects the opponent's strike rather than stopping it directly.

name: Slip
description: A defensive movement where you rotate your body to avoid a punch without blocking.

name: Bob and Weave
description: A defensive movement combining ducking and lateral movement to evade punches.

name: Hip Throw (O Goshi)
description: A fundamental Judo throw using hip rotation and leverage to throw the opponent over your hip.

name: Shoulder Throw (Seoi Nage)
description: A classic Judo throw pulling the opponent over your shoulder using arm control and hip movement.

name: Foot Sweep (De Ashi Barai)
description: A sweep that catches the opponent's foot as they step, disrupting balance and causing a fall.

name: Inner Thigh Throw (Uchi Mata)
description: A powerful Judo throw using the inner thigh to lift and throw the opponent.

name: Outer Reap (Osoto Gari)
description: A reaping throw that sweeps the opponent's leg from outside while pushing their upper body.

name: Single Leg Takedown
description: A wrestling takedown grabbing one of the opponent's legs and driving them to the ground.

name: Double Leg Takedown
description: A powerful wrestling takedown grabbing both legs and driving forward to take the opponent down.

name: Blast Double
description: An explosive variation of the double leg where you penetrate deeply and lift the opponent.

name: High Crotch Takedown
description: A wrestling takedown targeting the opponent's inner thigh area while controlling their upper body.

name: Armbar (Juji Gatame)
description: A joint lock submission that hyperextends the elbow by isolating the arm and applying pressure.

name: Rear Naked Choke
description: A chokehold applied from behind using the forearm to compress the carotid arteries.

name: Triangle Choke (Sankaku Jime)
description: A leg choke where you trap the opponent's head and arm in a triangle shape with your legs.

name: Guillotine Choke
description: A front choke wrapping your arm around the opponent's neck and squeezing, common in MMA.

name: Kimura Lock
description: A shoulder lock that rotates the arm behind the back, named after judoka Masahiko Kimura.

name: Americana Lock
description: A shoulder lock similar to the Kimura but applied from the opposite side, often from mount position.

name: Omoplata
description: A shoulder lock using your legs to control and submit the opponent by rotating their shoulder.

name: Heel Hook
description: A dangerous leg lock that attacks the heel and knee by rotating the foot.

name: Ankle Lock
description: A submission that hyperextends the ankle by applying pressure across the Achilles tendon.

name: Knee Bar
description: A leg lock that hyperextends the knee joint, highly effective but requires careful control.

name: Guard Position
description: A ground position where you're on your back with legs controlling the opponent, fundamental in BJJ.

name: Closed Guard
description: Guard position with legs locked around the opponent's back, providing maximum control.

name: Open Guard
description: Guard position with legs not locked, using hooks and grips to control the opponent.

name: Half Guard
description: A position where you control one of the opponent's legs between yours, defensive yet versatile.

name: Mount Position
description: A dominant top position sitting on the opponent's torso, prime position for strikes and submissions.

name: Side Control
description: A dominant top position perpendicular to the opponent, excellent for control and transitions.

name: Back Mount
description: The most dominant position in BJJ, mounted on the opponent's back with both hooks in.

name: Knee on Belly
description: A pressure position with knee on the opponent's stomach, uncomfortable and controls movement.

name: Sprawl
description: A defensive technique against takedowns, throwing legs back and driving weight down.

name: Clinch
description: A standing grappling position where fighters control each other, core to Muay Thai fighting.

name: Plum Clinch
description: A Muay Thai clinch controlling the opponent's head with both hands behind the neck.

name: Guard Pass
description: Technique to pass the opponent's guard and achieve a dominant top position.

name: Sweep
description: A technique from bottom position to reverse and get on top of the opponent.

name: Shrimp (Hip Escape)
description: A fundamental movement escaping from bottom positions by moving hips away.

name: Bridge
description: An escape technique lifting the hips explosively to create space or escape from bottom.

name: Technical Stand-Up
description: A safe method to stand up from the ground while maintaining guard against strikes.

name: Wall Walk
description: A technique to stand up from the ground using the cage wall for support in MMA.

name: Ground and Pound
description: Striking technique from top position, combining positional control with strikes.

name: Elbow from Guard
description: Defensive elbows thrown from guard position to attack the opponent on top.

name: Upkick
description: A kick thrown upwards from bottom position targeting the head of a standing opponent.

name: Imanari Roll
description: A flying entry into leg lock position, advanced and risky submission technique.

name: Cartwheel Kick
description: An acrobatic kick performed during a cartwheel motion, spectacular and effective.

name: Berimbolo
description: A spinning back take technique from De La Riva guard, modern sport BJJ technique.

name: Rolling Thunder Kick
description: A rolling backward kick executed while doing a backward roll, dynamic and unpredictable.

name: Bicycle Kick
description: An inverted kick performed while falling backward, both legs kicking alternately.

name: Butterfly Kick
description: An aerial kick where you twist horizontally in the air like a butterfly, used in demonstrations.

name: 540 Kick
description: A spinning kick where you spin 540 degrees before striking, extremely flashy technique.

name: Scorpion Kick
description: An inverted kick where you arch your back and kick forward over your head.
